review.title: Design & Development of the Graphical User Interface for Sindhi Language
review.abstract: This paper describes the design and implementation of a Unicode-based GUISL (Graphical User Interface for Sindhi Language). The idea is to provide a software platform to the people of Sindh as well as Sindhi diasporas living across the globe to make use of computing for basic tasks such as editing, composition, formatting, and printing of documents in Sindhi by using GUISL. The implementation of the GUISL has been done in the Java technology to make the system platform independent. The paper describes several design issues of Sindhi GUI in the context of existing software tools and technologies and explains how mapping and concatenation techniques have been employed to achieve the cursive shape of Sindhi script.

sections.heading: 3. Design & development of the GUISL
sections.text: In order to design and standardize the Sindhi user interface, three main problems are analyzed: Unicode of characters, keyboard layout, and Sindhi italics. Unfortunately, there is no sequence (sort) of Sindhi Unicode characters at the Unicode level, and all characters are scattered and mixed with Arabic and Farsi character sets, as shown in Fig. 4 (Sindhi characters are displayed in circles, highlighting their positions at the plane).The lack of a sequence and a separate character encoding set leads to the development of adhoc-based systems for the process of Sindhi computation.The first step is to change the orientation of all GUI elements (toolbar, status bar, writing direction, menus, tooltips, pop-up menus, etc.) in the system from right to left, thus rendering the initial, middle, and last representation of the characters correspondingly with the correct italics for the ligature [9] to form the word.

sections.heading: 3.3 GUI in Sindhi Language
sections.text: The system architecture contains the basic GUI elements grouped under the corresponding menu, and the menu groups are written in both English and Sindhi script for easy understanding.Figure 6 (a-e) illustrates the various user interface menus with Sindhi script designed for the GUISL. Menus are designed with tab-based layout rather than traditional drop-down menus.The file menu shown in Figure 6 (a) contains the basic tools for input operations such as (New File), (Open File), (Save File), etc. Figure 6 (b) shows the menu (Edit) containing the tools for the basic editing options, such as (Undo), (Redo), (Find), etc. Likewise, the keyboard menu (Dictionary) contains the menu in the corresponding menu.

sections.heading: 3.6 Message and Tool Windows
sections.text: All pop-up message and tool windows in the system contain the text in both Sindhi and English, as shown in Fig. 8 (a-b). Fig. 8 (a) shows the message window that appears before the file is closed to save the changes in both Sindhi and English. Fig. 8 (b) shows the Search and Replace tool window with Sindhi-English text in the title bar of the window and in the Search and Replace options tabs. Fig. 8 (c) below shows the task pane that displays the various tools and tasks in the system with Sindhi text on its labels and buttons.

sections.heading: 4. CONCLUSIONS & FUTURE DIRECTIONS
sections.text: This paper focuses on the question of designing and developing a GUISL. Various features and problems concerning the use of Sindhi in data processing were discussed, such as changing the alignment of the text from right to left, the arrangement / sorting of Sindhi Unicode characters and the appropriate italicity in word ligation. After successful implementation of the algorithms FIG. 6 (D). ON-SCREEN SINDHI SEQUENTIAL KEYBOARDFIG. 6 (E). ON.SCREEN SINDHI KEYBOARDdiscussed, the GUI of any application can be defined in Sindhi language. The topics and methods discussed can also be applied to other languages written in Perso-Arabic font. This work aimed at providing a general programming framework for the development of Sindhi-based applications. Based on the present work, we are now in the process of developing a text processor that supports Sindhi calculation and translation tools.
